name: Chef John's Baba Ghanoush
author: Chef John
summary: No matter what you're grilling this summer, chances are good you're going to have more hot coals than food to cook on it, which makes baba ghanoush the perfect post-barbecue recipe. This is a wonderfully savory yet refreshing vegetable dip.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons kosher salt, or to taste
1  lemon, juiced, or more to taste
3 tablespoons tahini, or more to taste
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
directions: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate
Prick the surface of the skin of eggplants several times with the tip of a knife
Turn frequently with tongs while skin chars
Cook until eggplants have collapsed and are very soft, 25 to 30 minutes
Transfer to a bowl and cover tightly with aluminum foil and allow to cool, about 15 minutes
When eggplants are cool enough to handle, split them in half and scrape flesh into a colander placed over a bowl
Add crushed garlic and salt; mash until creamy but with a little texture, about 5 minutes
Whisk in lemon juice, tahini, olive oil, and cayenne pepper
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until completely chilled, 3 or 4 hours
